etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Julius Berend Cohen (1859–1935). From pent- + -itol

definitions: Any of several isomeric pentahydric alcohols of the formula CH₂ OH·(CHOH)₃ ·CH₂ OH, derived from pentose sugars and often present in plant tissues, such as arabitol, ribitol, and xylitol.
